ca.mcgill.hs.classifiers
Class NativeClassifier

java.lang.Object
  ca.mcgill.hs.classifiers.NativeClassifier

public class NativeClassifier
extends java.lang.Object

Wraps the native C code for the classifier.

Field Summary
static int GTMALGORITHM_FULL_MATCH
          More brittle, but faster algorithm that matches the entire trace, that is the nearest neighbours are only computed for the starting point of the segment, and then the next points in the model are used as the "neighbours" for the next points in the trace, rather than being recomputed as in GTMALGORITHM_INDEP_STEPS.
static int GTMALGORITHM_INDEP_STEPS
          The original GTM algorithm (Frank et al., AAAI'10), which treats each step in the segment individually, that is that nearest neighbours are recomputed at each segment.
static int GTMALGORITHM_SEGMENT_MATCH
          Experimental algorithm, needs more testing.

Field Detail

GTMALGORITHM_INDEP_STEPS

public static final int GTMALGORITHM_INDEP_STEPS
The original GTM algorithm (Frank et al., AAAI'10), which treats each step in the segment individually, that is that nearest neighbours are recomputed at each segment.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

GTMALGORITHM_FULL_MATCH

public static final int GTMALGORITHM_FULL_MATCH
More brittle, but faster algorithm that matches the entire trace, that is the nearest neighbours are only computed for the starting point of the segment, and then the next points in the model are used as the "neighbours" for the next points in the trace, rather than being recomputed as in GTMALGORITHM_INDEP_STEPS. This algorithm should only be used if the segment length parameter is small.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

GTMALGORITHM_SEGMENT_MATCH

public static final int GTMALGORITHM_SEGMENT_MATCH
Experimental algorithm, needs more testing. Doesn't just find nearest neighbours in the model, but finds the closest point (approximate) on any line-segment in the model. Then this point along the line-segment is used, and a point midway on the next line segment is used as the next point. This should lead to better results, and is still fairly fast, but it's unclear that the approximations made in the implementation are sound.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

NativeClassifier

Method Detail

annClose

public void annClose()
Closes and frees the memory for the nearest-neighbour data structure.

annDist

public float annDist(int dim,
                     float[] p,
                     float[] q)
Computes the squared distance between points p and q, each having dim dimensions.

Parameters:
dim - The dimension of the points.
p - First point.
q - Second point.
Returns:
Squared interpoint distance.

buildTree

public void buildTree(java.lang.String in_file,
                      int m,
                      int p,
                      int d)
Builds a time-delay embedding model from data in in_file with embedding dimension m, PCA reduced dimension p, and delay time d. Model is saved in a file constructed from in_file with .dmp appended.

Parameters:
in_file - File name containing a single column of data points, from which the model is built.
m - Initial embedding dimension.
p - Number of principal components to use for final model.
d - Delay time in samples.

classifySample

public void classifySample(float[] in,
                           int startIndex,
                           float[] out)
Classifies the data in the array in, starting from index offset, and returned values are stored in output, which must be an array of length getNumModels().

Parameters:
in - Data to be classified.
startIndex - Starting index from which to classify for array in.
out - Scores, one per model. out must be preallocated with size equal to the number of models.

classifyTrajectory

public void classifyTrajectory(java.lang.String in_file,
                               java.lang.String out_file,
                               java.lang.String models_file)
Classifies an entire trajectory in the file specified by in_file, using the models from models_file, and storing the scores in out_file.

Parameters:
in_file - A file containing a single column of values representing the trajectory to be classified.
out_file - The file that will contain the scores. If the file exists, it will be overwritten.
models_file - A file containing the file names of the model files, one per line.

deleteModels

public void deleteModels()
Deletes any models and frees the memory allocated to them.

getModelNames

public java.lang.String getModelNames()
Returns a tab-separated list of model names

Returns:
A tab-separated list of model names.

getNumModels

public int getNumModels()
Returns the number of loaded models

Returns:
The number of loaded models

getWindowSize

public int getWindowSize()
Returns the minimum number of samples that must be passed to the classifySamples. It is the maximum of the window sizes required for all of the models.

Returns:
The minimum allowable size of an array that can be passed to classifySamples

loadModels

public void loadModels(java.lang.String models_file,
                       int numNeighbours,
                       int matchSteps)
Loads the models specified in models_file, and initializes the classifier parameters.

Parameters:
models_file - A file containing the model files, one per line.
numNeighbours - The number of neighbours used in the nearest-neighbours step of the classifier.
matchSteps - The length of the sequence that is compared by the classifier to compute the score.

setAlgorithmNumber

public void setAlgorithmNumber(int algNum)
Select the algorithm used by the classifier.

Parameters:
algNum - Algorithm number, must be one of GTMALGORITHM_INDEP_STEPS, GTMALGORITHM_FULL_MATCH, or GTMALGORITHM_SEGMENT_MATCH.
